fields.Name: Skip AssociationDB - Dual-Axis Time Series with 4-Level Drill-Down
fields.Description: Tests Skip's ability to create complex multi-series time-series charts with dual Y-axes and implement a 4-level progressive drill-down pattern through different visualization types.

InputDefinition.userMessage: I need a comprehensive dashboard showing our membership and revenue trends over the past 5 years. Create a line chart with two Y-axes: the left axis should show membership count (as a line), and the right axis should show total revenue (as a different colored line). Make the chart interactive so that when I click on any data point, it opens up a pie chart breaking down that specific year's activity by category (membership fees, event revenue, course revenue). Then, when I click on any slice of that pie chart, show me a detailed table of all the transactions in that category for that year. Finally, make sure I can click on any row in that transaction table to open the actual invoice or membership record in the system. I want to see clear axis labels, a legend distinguishing the two metrics, and smooth navigation through all four levels.

judgeValidationCriteria: Response includes dual-axis line chart with membership (left) and revenue (right)
Chart spans 5 years with proper time-series formatting
Two distinct colored lines with clear legend
Clicking any data point opens pie chart for that year's revenue breakdown
Pie chart shows three categories: membership fees, event revenue, course revenue
Clicking pie slice shows transaction table filtered to that category and year
Transaction table includes date, amount, type, and member information
Table rows are clickable to open invoice or membership records via OpenEntityRecord
Navigation maintains context throughout all 4 levels
All levels have clear titles indicating current selection context
